text: Acleris kearfottana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Maine, Ontario, Pennsylvania, Quebec and West Virginia.mothphotographersgroup The wingspan is about 15 mm. The forewings are pale orange-yellow with faint traces of reticulation. The hindwings are light smoky.McDunnough, J. 1934. The Canadian species of the Tortricid genus Peronea. Canadian Journal of Research, 1934, 11(3): 290-332 Adults have been recorded on wing in April, July and from October to November. The larvae feed on Comptonia peregrina, Myrica (including Myrica gale) and Hamamelis species.Tortricidae Food Plant Database ==References== Category:Moths described in 1934 kearfottana Category:Moths of North America
title: Acleris kearfottana
